image.altText: A woman holding a small jar filled with white vitamins.

props.synopsis: A rise in the number of B6 toxicity cases across the nation has sparked action by the TGA to move products behind pharmacy counters.

title.children: 'Nerve damage': TGA recommends vitamin B6 products be removed from shelves

image.altText: a weather graph over nsw of a forecast weather bomb

props.synopsis: Forget the headlines and hyperbole of the fictitious "rain bomb" — the real weather bomb is possible along Australia's east coast next week.

title.children: 'Bomb cyclone' ahead for Australia's east coast

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu point his index finger to the sky with an aggressive look

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejects a report in Israeli newspaper Haaretz that Israeli soldiers were ordered to shoot at Palestinians approaching aid sites in Gaza, calling the allegation a "malicious falsehood".

title.children: Netanyahu denies report IDF soldiers were told to shoot Gaza aid-seekers

image.altText: A crowd gathered in front of a stage where red green white coloured flags are draped

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of mourners line the streets of downtown Tehran for the funeral of the head of the Revolutionary Guard and other top commanders and nuclear scientists killed during Iran's 12-day war with Israel.

title.children: Iran holds state funeral for military officials killed in war with Israel

image.altText: A man in a suit stands with his arms out behind a lectern, with two other men in suits standing either side of him

props.synopsis: The US president says he would consider further military action in Iran, as the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade confirms 3,200 Australians and family members in the country register with a crisis service.

title.children: Trump says he could bomb Iran again, as DFAT crisis register grows

image.altText: An image of a dead dolphin at Grange Beach.

props.synopsis: Dolphins, sea lions, sharks, rays and fish have all been sighted washed up dead on Adelaide's beaches as the impact of the algal bloom continues to be felt across the state.

title.children: 'Heartbreaking' algal bloom hits metropolitan Adelaide beaches

image.altText: Three Collingwood AFL players celebrate a goal.

props.synopsis: The Magpies lift when required against the bottom-placed Eagles, recording a 29-point win at Docklands, while the Hawks and Suns also celebrate victories.

title.children: Ladder-leading Magpies survive major scare from gutsy Eagles

image.altText: Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow of the Dolphins makes a Dolphin gesture in celebration

props.synopsis: Star fullbacks Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow and Reece Walsh shine on Saturday, with the vacant number one jersey for the Queensland Maroons up for grabs.

title.children: Hammer scores four, Walsh stars with Maroons fullback spot up for grabs

image.altText: Tomos Williams leaves the field injured for the British and Irish Lions.

props.synopsis: Henry Pollock shows off his star potential, but teammate Tomos Williams is cut down by a hamstring injury as the British and Irish Lions hand the Western Force a crushing defeat in Perth.

title.children: British and Irish Lions suffer injury blow in 54-7 win over Western Force

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a bag of frozen frogs.

props.synopsis: Meat and seafood producers are calling for tougher biosecurity penalties after a woman avoided a prison term for illegally importing 62,000kg of meat, fish and insect-infested fruit from Thailand.

title.children: Industry aghast as black marketeer avoids jail for 62-tonne food import

image.altText: Lauren Sanchez in a floral wedding dress and Jeff Bezos in a suit.

props.synopsis: The sky itself is no limit for billionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancée Lauren Sánchez and expectations were about as high ahead of their wedding in Venice.

title.children: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's Venice wedding in pictures

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Missing Persons Squad detectives discovered the remains after executing a warrant at a home in Westmeadows today, but they are yet to be formally identified.

title.children: Human remains found in police search for missing Melbourne man

image.altText: Boy running hand along fence

props.synopsis: A 13-year-old boy was left languishing in a homeless shelter for months because of Tasmanian child protection department's "gross negligence", a family member says.

title.children: Family of 13yo left at homeless shelter for months worry he won't live past his childhood

image.altText: Two men stand side by side, Carney's arms are outstretched

props.synopsis: The move plunges US-Canada relations back into chaos after a period of relative calm that included a cordial G7 meeting in mid-June where the countries' leaders agreed to wrap up a new economic agreement within 30 days.

title.children: Trump abruptly cuts off trade talks with Canada

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: This is why the world’s richest people — also known as the 'broligarchs' — are about to get a whole lot richer.

title.children: How Trump's tax triumph will cost Australians dearly

image.altText: A man with a big black and grey beard stands with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: From online crusader to censured councillor, Big Rob's little fights have become big problems for a regional city still recovering from natural disasters.

title.children: Is this man Australia's most divisive local councillor?

image.altText: Four people in orange high vis tops, blue pants and hard hats walk along a raised concrete walkway inside a concrete tunnel.

props.synopsis: A state government frontbencher has retreated from initial denials that the Metro Rail Tunnel won't be fully operational until 2026.

title.children: Victorian Government concedes Metro Tunnel opening details still uncertain

image.altText: A woman and man pose for a photo while dancing at a wedding

props.synopsis: In 2016, Linda Moussa's parter died after a falling at a worksite, with negligence later pinned as a driving factor. After receiving a financial boost from the government, SafeWork NSW is hoping to hold employers accountable for breaking safety laws.

title.children: SafeWork NSW to 'hold more employers to account' after worksite deaths

image.altText: Capaldi throws up a peace sign and smiles on stage, wearing a white tee and black bomber jacket

props.synopsis: From Lewis Capaldi's emotional performance on the Pyramid Stage to Lorde's surprise album party, here's what happened at Glastonbury on Friday.

title.children: Surprise sets punctuate Glastonbury's Friday line-up

image.altText: A woman in a white jumper is holding a book open, smiling

props.synopsis: It's a story that became Aussie folklore, but for the descendants of those involved, the ripple effects of that frosty night 145 years ago would be felt for generations.

title.children: Fallout from Ned Kelly's last stand haunted families for generations

image.altText: She sits on a bench by the sea and looks at the ocean

props.synopsis: Jayde Guest spends most evenings lying on the couch in excruciating pain. Frustrated by the health system, she has taken matters into her own hands.

title.children: 'I want my life back': Woman struggles for solution to chronic pain

image.altText: Sydney player Joel Amartey has his arms outstreched in celebration and an open mouthed smile.

props.synopsis: Brandon Walker, Joel Amartey, Isaac Quaynor and Connor Idun all have a rich Ghanaian heritage that's shaping the way they play.

title.children: The Ghanaian-Australian quartet making a mark on the AFL

image.altText: James Wharton posing with the sign for first place, holding his index finger in the air

props.synopsis: Australian Formula 3 driver James Wharton has claimed his maiden win in the category, triumphing in Austria during the Formula 1 Austrian Grand Prix weekend.

title.children: Australian James Wharton takes maiden Formula 3 race win

image.altText: Banded stilts in flight near Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: With Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre expecting its most significant fill in decades, hundreds of thousands of migratory birds are flocking to the inland oasis, but how they know the rare event is happening is an "enduring mystery".

title.children: How birds know when Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is full remains a mystery

image.altText: Donald Trump, seated at his desk, holds up a signed piece of paper as three men and a woman stand behind him looking on.

props.synopsis: While the deal could be a turning point in the struggle to end the conflict, many Congolese see the deal mainly as an opportunity for the US to acquire Congo's critical minerals.

title.children: DRC and Rwanda sign US-mediated peace deal to end bloody conflict

image.altText: Two men hold aloft a red and white banner outside a court which reads 'MAGA justices are taking away our hard-won rights'

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is celebrating what he calls a "giant win" after the US Supreme Court limited the power of federal judges to block the president's executive orders.

title.children: 'Giant win' for Trump after top court limits judges' power to block his orders

image.altText: Jennifer Board smiles as she looks back to the camera while sat on the beach at what appears to be sunset.

props.synopsis: Jennifer Board's death shocked the Townsville community but with time her loved ones have turned pain into purpose.

title.children: How Jennifer, the innocent victim of a car chase, left a legacy of joy

image.altText: A composite image of Sean "Diddy" Combs and Harvey Weinstein.

props.synopsis: Two cases in the New York courts have put the city's once-powerful movie and music moguls — and the #MeToo movement — under new scrutiny.

title.children: Two New York moguls offer a pulse check for the #MeToo movement

image.altText: A dusty Citroen covered with diamond stickers

props.synopsis: Recent strangers now lifelong friends after a week on the road have parted ways with their beloved "sh**boxes" as the cancer research charity run culminated with an auction in Darwin on Saturday.

title.children: Beloved 'sh**boxes' find forever homes as charity rally comes to a close

image.altText: An illustration of a woman and child in front of a tiled background.

props.synopsis: In a country where dissidents face arrest or even execution, 10 Iranians — including a teacher, a mother, and a labourer — put themselves at risk to document the war.

title.children: The voices from inside Iran the regime doesn't want you to hear

image.altText: A loaded sweet potato with creamy mushroom, chicken with grated cheese on top ready to grill.

props.synopsis: Roasted sweet potatoes are filled with a creamy mushroom and chicken filling and finished with a good grating of sharp cheddar. Think cosy, creamy and comforting.

title.children: Loaded sweet potatoes with creamy mushroom chicken are perfect for winter

image.altText: Mechelle Turvey and Stephen Cleal hug outside court.

props.synopsis: After three years, a national outcry, and the sentencing of her son's murderers, Mechelle Turvey is still a force for change.

title.children: It took years to sentence her son's killers. Mechelle Turvey knew the truth

image.altText: Female hikers walking on a rocky forest trail surrounded by tall trees and greenery.

props.synopsis: A growing number of women say they want community, physical activity and time outdoors — just without the gasps for air that come with trying to chat mid-run.

title.children: Women turn to alternatives to running for 'outdoorsy' group exercise

image.altText: Two men on a sofa smile at each as one bottle feeds a baby on his lap.

props.synopsis: With more Australians finding surrogate mothers overseas, parents and lawyers are calling for an overhaul of Australia's "patchwork" laws, while some ethicists say paying for babies should remain illegal.

title.children: Should Australia have a babies-for-profit industry? Some think so
